title: Squadron Superintendent
description: Provide counsel to the commander in the execution of the EC-130H COMPASS CALL Field Training Unit. Ensure effective use of ACC accredited syllabi for the initial qualification training of 8 Air Force Specialties. Provide input to the commander on personnel, budgetary and other issues as needed. Ensure proper staffing levels and recruit/interview new personnel for placement. Maintain a database of potential future candidates. - Managed $2.5B in training resources and supervised an academic contract worth $6.4M/yr - Directed 81 instructors in the accomplishment of 1.7K training events exceeding 29K hours - Produced 182 qualified aviators, bested historic days late average by 30%, stayed on budget - Farsi and Dari SME, led the development & modification of 22 regionally accredited syllabi - Ensured proper administration of the Command Language Prgm and the Cryptologic Skills Prgm - Guided training and professional development of 150+ cryptologic language analysts
